H0.text: A viral vector is a tool commonly used by molecular biologists to place genetic material into cells.

H1.text: An embryonic vector is a tool commonly used by molecular biologists to place genetic material into cells.

H2.text: An RNA vector is a tool commonly used by molecular biologists to place genetic material into cells.

H3.text: A DNA vector is the name for a tool commonly used by molecular biologists to place genetic material into cells.

A4.text: Artificial plasmids are put into mammalian cells to make them produce a certain gene product.

A5.text: Vectors Artificially constructed plasmids may be used as vectors in genetic engineering.
